page.title: 08ECOLOGY, ALLERTHORPE COMMON
page.content: ECOLOGY; ALLERTHORPE COMMON. Large area of uncultivated unfarmed land with natural abundant growth. Patches of Willow Herb, Heather, Gorse,Broom, Bracken and undisturbed nettles. There is Lichen on the ground and around the base of the trees, coarse grass(reed like), the ground becomes very wet in places if pressure applied. There is evidence of rabbits and moles. The bramble bushes are full of unripened fruit. Besides one of the public footpaths is an apple tree, it has grown to a height of approx.7ft.,and the apples though not yet ripe looked free from disease. The Common is an area where foxgloves, & yellow Rod grows wild. In spite of the crop spraying which has taken place around the common the ox-eye daisies and poppies still border the paths.
